features: ✔ Ultra Slim and Sturdy Metal Design: Merely 0.4 inch thick. All-Aluminum anti-scratch model delivers remarkable strength and durability, keeping this portable hard drive running cool and quiet

✔ A Reliable Game Drive: This PS4 external hard drive features fast and stable performance for PS4, PS4 Pro, and Xbox One, does not refuse or delete a game. Compatible with Microsoft Windows and Mac OS(10.6.5 and above) in the meantime

✔ Improve PC Performance: Powered by USB 3.0 technology, this USB hard drive is much faster than - but still compatible with - USB 2.0 backup drive, allowing for super fast transfer speed at up to 5 Gbit/s
✔ Plug and Play: This external drive is ready to use without external power supply or software installation needed. Ideal extra storage for your computer and game console
✔ What's Included: Portable external hard drive, 19-inch(48.26cm) USB 3.0 hard drive cable, user's manual, 3-Year manufacturer warranty with free technical support service
body.description: Introducing Maxone Ultra Slim Portable Hard Drive USB 3.0 Ready, USB 2.0 Compatible Powered by USB 3.0 technology, Maxone portable hard drives are much faster than USB 2.0, allowing for speedy transfer when organizing your files. This portable hard drive by default is formatted as exFAT, which works well with Windows and Mac. Some of the old devices may need reformat. No reformat required for Windows and Mac, just plug it in and play. Y cable will be needed for Wii U. To maximize performance, please connect your hard drive to a USB 3.0 port, also compatible with USB 2.0.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The Actual Usable Storage Capacity May Be Less Type of file system used for the drive, partitioning arrangement and type of operating system could affect the actual storage capacity displayed by your computer. 1MB=1,000,000 bytes, 1GB=1,000,000,000 bytes. 160GB ≈ 149GB 250GB ≈ 238GB 320GB ≈ 298GB 500GB ≈ 465GB 1TB ≈ 931GB Introducing Maxone Ultra Slim Portable Hard Drive USB 3.0 Ready, USB 2.0 Compatible Powered by USB 3.0 technology, Maxone portable hard drives are much faster than USB 2.0, allowing for speedy transfer when organizing your files. This portable hard drive by default is formatted as exFAT, which works well with Windows and Mac. Some of the old devices may need reformat. No reformat required for Windows and Mac, just plug it in and play. Y cable will be needed for Wii U. To maximize performance, please connect your hard drive to a USB 3.0 port, also compatible with USB 2.0.

Easy to Use Maxone Ultra Slim external hard drive is ready to use without external power supply or software installation needed. Simply drag and drop files you want to save. Improve PC Performance Offering high storage capacity up to 2TB, this drive is made to free up more space and effectively improve the performance of your PC and laptop. Ultra Compact and Light Weight All-Aluminum anti-scratch model offers stronger exterior protection, delivering remarkable strength and durability. Yet this drive is also compact and light weight. Easy to carry around wherever you go.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Affordable Solution for Those File Hoarders Amongst Us
reviews.reviewText: When I first bought a new laptop a few years ago, 237 GB of hard drive seemed like it would last forever. It wasn't until recent times when trying to install my latest purchase of Far Cry 6 only to discover it required a whopping 60GB of memory and the available space on the current internal hard drive was but a sliver in comparison. Even after deleting or uninstalling everything I truly didn't need, it still was not enough (Windows 10 itself is a memory hog), thus I had little choice except to buy a new computer or install a larger hard drive. A new laptop was economically out, especially when the current one was still running fine and I did not want to have to deal with installing another internal drive given the difficulty of placing one in even the larger confines of a desktop I had experienced years back.So, finding out external hard drives had now shrunk to a size where they wouldn't take up too much space on a desk and actually be portable, I purchase the Maxone Ultra Slim Portable and so far, I've not been disappointed.At about 4 1/2" in length and 3 1/2" in width, the Maxone is definitely svelte and very unobtrusive next to the computer itself (though I keep it behind it). It is simple plug and play and connects to any available USB port with a standard cable (though one came with it). At about 18" the supplied cable is kind of short, but seeing as how one will likely have the drive close to the computer, that is not really an issue and as stated, any similar, longer cords would work just as well. It is small enough that I can fit it into my laptop case with both the computer and mouse if I need to access something on the external drive away from home.Installing said video game took almost the better part of the day, but I think it had more to do with the size of the program, as well as the Steam download speed and less to do with the hard drive itself. I imagine transferring standard files, like photos and such, should prove to be faster, but so far, I've only used the Maxone for the game as I still have room for everything else on the computer itself. The game ran fine on the Maxone and didn't crash once during the several weeks off and on it took me to complete it.Overall, I am satisfied with it and the value for the additional amount of memory. I will likely reserve the Maxone for downloaded games as until Moore's Law catches up with programs and gaming graphics, it will likely be enough additional memory for my needs or at least until the graphics card in the laptop itself can no longer run the latest games. Though I may also eventually use it to back up some important files as failing to do so in the past was a tragic lesson I do not wish to repeat and thus, the Maxone would also be good for redundancy storage and I may eventually purchase another one for just that purpose exclusively.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Working good. - Still working good!!
reviews.reviewText: Filled this up with Anime, TV and Movies, got about 60gigs left and it's been about a month. It's doin the thing well, I'm happy with it. The plastic on the edges does seem fragile, but I could care less about that. Only gripe is that it ends up only being 465gb to use.Edit: it's now Feb 25th, almost half a year of use, I've removed and added plenty, it's put through daily almost all day every day use and I have yet to have an issue, plan on getting a second 1tb and just keeping this one for just anime, great buy and a great price! Definitely been recommending this to people.Edit: it's now August 26th, I have noticed some videos not playing like they used to, this may be due to getting a second one and having them both plugged in and running and the same time (my laptop isn't the best) other than that all files are still there, they still play (though some Mkv files seem to have more artifacts, this could just be my laptop though)Feb 14th 2020, final edit: still works fine, no complaints.May 5th 2022, finalfinal edit: it's been years and years and it still works.Sept 18th 2022; I bought a second one, the first one still works, I just wanted one for my extended storage on the PlayStation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sleek, Slim, and Portable
reviews.reviewText: I needed a small external hard drive and this one does the job perfectly while also being extremely compact. I have no complaints and haven't run into any issues trying to use it--it's simply just a plug and play external HDD. Some things to note, however:1. The hard drive uses a USB micro-B to USB-A cable, meaning that you won't be able to plug a regular USB-A or USB-C cable into the hard drive itself. This isn't a deal breaker, but if you lose the cable, I doubt you will have another one lying around.2. The hard drive is a hard drive. This isn't your premium external solid-state drive, so don't expect premium SSD speeds out of this drive. By no means is this HDD slow, but it isn't exactly fast either. For the price, however, this is about as good as it gets.Overall, I would absolutely recommend this drive to anyone looking for a simple, compact external HDD at a reasonable price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Seems well built. Good value. However, only over time can quality be assessed. On the plus side the warranty is for 3 yrs. Recommend longer cable as even with a moderate size TV, the HDD hangs from the cable (won’t lay flat) and is under tension possibly damaging the connection pin over time.

reviews.reviewTitle: it works good for xbox one
reviews.reviewText: was worried it wouldn’t work for game storage for my xbox one, it works perfect and gives you way more storage space
Used as a network drive in my router. Performs excellent.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Immediately recognised by my Samsung Neo Qled tv which then formatted, initialised and tested the drive. Ready to use in minutes. Made a quick recording of a half hour SD program which used 600MB of the 292GB available. Excellent product and brilliant value for money.

Voy al grano que si no te aburres.El producto es lo que es, un disco HDD conectado por USB 3.0 con picos de velocidad de 70mb/s aprox de escritura. Yo he comprado el de 500 GB solo para guardar copias de seguridad de fotografías y vídeos de mis sesiones y viajes y rinde que te cagas.No deja de ser un HDD pero oye, un buen HDD y muy barato. Vale la pena, sin más.

J’avais besoin de deux disques durs afin d’échanger des dossiers assez lourds, chaque fin de semaine : un à remplir, l’autre à reprendre en échange.Il me les fallait d’assez grande capacité (500 Go est idéal, notamment pour des fichiers vidéo 4K) et légers. Et surtout fiables.Qu’ils soient rapides était un plus, mais non indispensable.Mon commentaire est le même pour les deux, puisque ce sont des modèles identiques.Ce disque dur Maxone de 500 Go répond à mes attentes, les dépasse même.Arrivé rapidement (une fois encore, merci Amazon prime).Le package comprend également un câble de 47 cm et une notice (en anglais)Formaté d’origine en Exfat. Je me suis demandé si je le conservais sous ce format ou si je le convertissais en Mac OS étendu, puisque nous fonctionnons tous deux sous Apple. Finalement, j’ai décidé de conserver le format d’origine puisque les ordis Apple lisent les deux formats, et que je pourrais être amené à échanger avec quelqu’un qui travaille avec Windows (je ne pense pas, mais on ne sait jamais).Présentation : élégant avec son boîtier en alu noir, bien fini, et surtout très mince, ce qui est agréable dans ma sacoche. Atout très appréciable qui s’y rajoute : il ne pèse que 195 g. avec son câble. Il est solide : tombé une fois, sans aucune conséquence (ce n’est pas à faire, évidemment, mais lorsque cela arrive on est bien content que le matériel tienne le coup !).Fonctionnement : impeccable. Reconnu immédiatement, il monte dans l’instant sur le “Desktop”. Une petite diode bleue à côté du port de branchement signale qu’il est branché et en fonctionnement. Consommation impondérable puisqu’il est branché sur l’ordinateur et alimenté par celui-ci.Rigoureusement aucun bruit de fonctionnement (à se demander si ce n'est pas un SSD !)Performances appréciables : très rapide, bien qu’il soit annoncé à 5400 t/m, grâce à la technologie USB-3. Bien entendu, un peu moins rapide en USB-2, mais c’est lié à cette ancienne technologie, pas au disque dur ! Ceci dit, il fonctionne impeccablement tant en USB-2 qu’en USB-3 : compatibilité parfaite.Ces disques durs seront-t-il résistants dans le temps ? Je ne sais évidemment pas. Mais le sérieux de la fabrication domine. En quelques jours ils ont supporté chaque fois près de 400 Go de fichiers images et vidéos, chargés, transférés, effacés, à 11 reprises ; sans chauffer, à peine tièdes après le chargement du tout. Toujours aussi impeccables, bien que fonctionnant sur deux ordinateurs différents (l’un en MacOS Mojave (10.14), l’autre en Mas OS Ventura (13).Au passage, à savoir : testé sur un PC portable sous Windows (je ne sais pas lequel) : il fonctionne tout aussi bien. C’est donc (en plus) un excellent outil d’échange de fichiers entre plateformes différentes.Je recommande avec d’autant moins d’hésitations que c’est pour nous un outil de travail indispensable.
